result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of One Hundred Dollars (100.00) plus costs and surcharges within 120 days or set up a payment plan within the Clerk of Courts.
-Comply with all conditions of probation relative to count 2, misdemeanor intimidation of a victim, in this file. Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition. 
-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the State shall be free to argue for any disposition it deems appropriate, up to and including the maximum sentence provided by law.

-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c). 
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to amend count 1 to reflect a violation of misdemeanor battery, as and act of domestic abuse, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.19(1), 968.075 with a joint recommendation for a time served sentence concurrent with Count 2 with credit for time served.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonas Wayne Wilson

records.addlTxt: Corrected JOC to reflect correct date convicted
Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure

9:03 AM Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court.  Attorney Andrew T Poole in court for Jonas Wayne Wilson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State recites agreement. Defendant will plead to counts 1 and 2. Count 1 will be subject to a deferred agreement for a period of 3 years. Count 2 will be a withheld sentence in favor of 2 years of probation. Conditions of DOC programming, 30 days in jail with 3 days credit, $100 fine plus costs, and no contact condition will be left up to the discretion of the DOC. State has no objection to delayed report date and huber for work. 
Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Attorney Poole stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the pleas of guilty and finds that the pleas have been freely, voluntarily, and intelligently made. Judgment of conviction is entered on count 2 and judgment of conviction is deferred pursuant to the agreement in count 1 for a period of 3 years (Sept 26, 2025). Count 3 is dismissed. Defendant's address is verified and updated. 
Court orders on count 2, a withheld sentence in favor of 2 years of probation. Conditions of DOC programming, 30 days in jail with 3 days credit, $100 fine plus costs, bail to be applied to financial balance. Jail report date of November 26, 2022 at 6:00 PM, defendant's request for huber is granted.

9:04 AM Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court.  Attorney Andrew T Poole in court for Jonas Wayne Wilson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes matter is resolved and asks for plea/sentencing date. Attorney Poole in agreement. Court sets plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:28 AM Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew T Poole in court for Jonas Wayne Wilson. State indicates this case is heading towards an agreement, requests for another status. Attorney Poole agrees.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court.  Attorney Andrew T Poole in court for Jonas Wayne Wilson. 
Att Poole- received information, not guilty pleas, requests status
Court sets date
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

02:58 PM Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court and not in-custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is willing to waive time limits. State indicates there are no objections. Court accepts the waiver of time limits as these were made knowingly and voluntarily.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 08:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key

No contact with victim 1, victim 1's child, or their address as listed in the ID Key,   No use or possession of alcohol.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

03:12 PM Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in court with attorney .  Defendant Jonas Wayne Wilson in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonas Wayne Wilson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address confirmed.    Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.  States request on bail: $1000 cash bail with conditions of   No contact with victim 1, victim 1's child, or their address,   No use or possession of alcohol.  No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State gives prior criminal history of defendant and most of the history is in Minnesota.
Atty Hoffman questions Defendant. Defendant resides in Cloquet, MN. Family in Spooner. Defendant is employeed. Defendant has minimal amount to post right now but could post more on Friday.
Court Orders $1000 cash bail with conditions of  No contact with victim 1, victim 1's child, or their address as listed in the ID Key,  no use or possession of alcohol, no use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Atty Hoffman indicates Defendant does not qualify. Court inquires if Defendant wants to waive time limits. Defendant indicates he will leave things as is for now  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:45 am.  Status conference scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
